definition: lit. reincarnated in sb else's body (idiom); fig. a discarded or discredited idea returns in another guise
to lend/to borrow/by means of/to take (an opportunity)
person representing the dead (during burial ceremonies)/to put a corpse on display (after execution)/variant of 屍|尸[shi1]/corpse
still/still in progress/still more/yet/even more/in addition/fairly/passably (good)/as early as/even/also/else
soul/spirit/immortal soul, i.e. that can be detached from the body
to return from the grave/(old) to recycle (waste products)
lit. the plum tree withers in place of the peach tree/to substitute one thing for another/to carry the can for sb
to be reborn/to recover/to come back to life/to regenerate
to rise from the dead (idiom); fig. an unexpected recovery
lit. the cicada sheds its carapace (idiom); fig. to vanish leaving an empty shell/a crafty escape plan
sudden movement of a corpse (superstition)/fig. sudden torrent of abuse
dead but showing no signs of rigor mortis/to die hard (idiom)/to die yet not be vanquished (idiom)
